content: It's good and I would have given it five stars if it told you what the solution is when you can't find it. Have had a couple puzzles where I think I've tried every possible permutation on the board, and it just keeps going wrong move, wrong move, wrong move. When you give up, you don't find out what the solution actually was. You feel as if it's just been taking the mickey. Other than that it's pretty good
replyContent: Thanks for your review. You can actually see the solution just use the > and < buttons from the bottom toolbar under the board. Use < to go one move backward, use > to move one move forward in the solution. You also have engine analysis integrated, accessible by pressing the switch button in the bottom toolbar.

content: Nice graphics and excellent puzzles, but there's no 'hint' feature, which nearly all tactics apps have and should have. The algebraic notation looks weird and is incorrect, even when you change the settings. A good app overall though.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. I believe "hint" has the side effect of artificially increase the ELO and hinders progress; you can try engine analysis instead to improve your tactical sharpness with what if scenarios aka variations. The notation used is long algebraic notation Nb1-c3 N means Knight, b1 source square, c3 destination square.

content: Mostly amazing and fun puzzles! That being said I've run into a few puzzles that definitely seem off and where the computer moves didn't make any sense to me. Mostly awesome though, I've played a lot of these puzzles and they almost all seem really legit

This is a truly masterful app. -no ads -offline -can be played casually (if you don't care about your elo) -deep puzzles that teach you to think ahead and be patient. -easy puzzles to learn your combinations or even just understand how pieces move Play it how you want it. Be serious or casual. Learn or de-stress. This is an excellent app to keep your mind sharp during idle times of the day.
replyContent: We are pleased that you enjoyed the app. If there is anything we can do for you, just let us know at jyce.solutions@gmail.com! Have a wonderful day!

content: I wish there were a way to focus one skill. Far too many "best move" puzzles, where the answer doesn't become apparent until half a dozen moves later, when Stockfish changes from better to winning. Also, that the leaderboard has people with ELO scores above 3,000 is absurd.
Thank you for your response. Update: How do we review our completed puzzles? Further update: When I am trying to see the completed puzzles, I can't see anything :/
replyContent:
Hi,
You can only see solution of a finished puzzle. Press Resign button and you will see two buttons on the toolbar below the board; use them to navigate forward or backward into the solution. You can also analyze using Stockfish 11 engine the puzzle moves by using the switch button at the left of the bottom toolbar. Hope you update the rating.

The app is excellent but there are better or alternative solutions for many 
puzzles

Well... It's good for an App. But a lot of puzzles disregard the essence of 
Chess. A +9 move might be better than a +8.9 one, but the later shan't 
lower your ELO. Also, the ELO rating here is just a guess and reports a way 
higher value, than I'm capable to achieve in real world.

Congratulations D-le Musca! Excellent design, with great puzzles, very well chosen. Ergonomic UI with good menus and all  features you expect. ELO Rating well matched with difficulty. I chose to buy the app to support development and reward the passion and effort. One small remark: would it be possible to add a feature allowing to return to previous puzzles and mark them as favorites?...
replyContent:
Hi!
Thank you for the kind words!
In a future release favorite puzzles functionality will be available.
